Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian, probably Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice with part of bowl; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with rosette in centre of bowl in added white and added red; exterior: reserved on bowl, glazed streaky black on foot; inscriptions on underside of foot and on exterior.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 64, no. 753, pl. XXI, no. 753)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 682, no. 404)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1141) (phase 2)
